definition: to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly

sentences.english: Look at my feet, grandma frozen stiff decided to make a pair of cloth padded boots.
sentences.chinese: 看着我冻僵的小脚，奶奶决定给我做一双布棉鞋。

sentences.english: His hands, numb from the cold, could not find the key.
sentences.chinese: 他的手冻僵了，摸不到钥匙。

sentences.english: The girl  thawed her frozen hands in front of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 女孩在火边让冻僵的手暖和起来。

sentences.english: I often come out , stamp of stamp one's foot, can be frozen stiff really otherwise.
sentences.chinese: 我不时出来走走，跺跺脚，否则真会被冻僵。

sentences.english: The frozen corpses had to be separated with boiling water.
sentences.chinese: 冻僵的尸体粘结在一起只能用开水将他们分开。

sentences.english: Katinka froze, her limbs stiffened, and she fell motionless.
sentences.chinese: 卡廷卡冻僵了，她的四肢都麻木了，浑身失去了直觉。

sentences.english: The small frozen stiff bird lay in the cow's excrement and discovered it was really too warm.
sentences.chinese: 冻僵的小鸟躺在牛屎堆里，发掘牛粪真是太温暖了。

sentences.english: I was frozen solid by the snow on Yulong Mountain.
sentences.chinese: 我在玉龙雪山上被冻僵了。

sentences.english: Walking home in the snow, we got chilled to the bone.
sentences.chinese: 我们蹚着雪往家走，快要冻僵了。

sentences.english: I'm frozen - could you close the window?
sentences.chinese: 我冻僵了都，你可以关下窗吗？

sentences.english: Then the cold penetrates the double layer of gloves and sets to work on chilling my fingers.
sentences.chinese: 然后寒冷穿透双层手套开始来冻僵我的手指。

sentences.english: "Basically everything with lots of carbs froze, " said Venn-Watson.
sentences.chinese: “基本上，一切碳结构食品都冻僵了，”微安说到。

sentences.english: The homeless was benumbed with cold.
sentences.chinese: 那个无家可归者被冻僵了。

sentences.english: The man who said we'd be frozen up in mid-January said a mouthful.
sentences.chinese: 那人说一月中旬我们会冻僵的，他说得很对。

sentences.english: Frozen German casualties were removed from their foxholes and Allied troops moved in.
sentences.chinese: 冻僵的德国伤员被抬出散兵坑，他们的战友再挪进去。

sentences.english: They might experience numbness in their hands because of the cold.
sentences.chinese: 他们或许可以感受一下寒冷将双手冻僵的情况。

definition: cold weather, frozen ground (idiom); bitterly cold
to tremble/to shiver/uncontrolled shaking of the body
a world of ice and snow
to tremble/to shake out/to reveal/to make it in the world
